page.title: 08SURROUNDING HISTORY 1
page.content:
Roman Villa
This area has been inhabited from Neolithic times and occasional finds are still being made. The pipe line constructed this year has uncovered Roman traces on Sudeley Hill. Roman coins were also found in 1882. The Roman Villa in Spoonley Wood was discovered in 1882. It may have had as many as forty rooms and a well. A protective roof was erected over the mosaics but it has collapsed and the site has become overgrown and souvenir takers have removed bits of the Villa. There are remains on exhibition in Cheltenham Museum. The Villa occupied an area 200ft by 140ft.
